title: Papua New Guinea Invests in Renewable Energy Projects
content: Papua New Guinea is taking major steps to expand its renewable energy sector, with new solar and hydroelectric projects planned across the country. These initiatives aim to provide cleaner, more reliable electricity to remote communities, reduce dependence on fossil fuels, and support sustainable economic growth. Government agencies are partnering with international organizations to ensure that these projects are environmentally friendly and benefit local populations.
excerpt: Papua New Guinea launches solar and hydroelectric initiatives to boost renewable energy access and promote sustainable development across the country.

title: Energy Policies Launched
content:
MINISTRY for Energy and National Energy Authority (NEA) have launched five (5) new sub-sectors renewable policies that will guide investment and development in renewable energy that will support electricity generation in the energy sector.

NEA managing director Ronald Meketa said as the energy regulator in the country, NEA as the authority with that mandate has undertaken policy functions to regulate the energy sector in the country where NEA developed five policies. National Executive Council has approved all the five policies

The five sub-sectors are;

  1. Hydro Energy Policy 2025-2030,

  2. Geothermal Energy Policy 2025-2030,

  3. Wind Energy Policy 2030

  4. Solar Energy Policy 2030 and Bioenergy Policy.

Minister for Energy Peter Isoaimo acknowledge the development partners, representatives from the private sector, members of civil society who played a vital role in advancing our energy sector. The support came from National Government, Asian Development Bank, World Bank, Independent Power Producers, non-government organizations and other partners who have contribute towards the policies.

 Minister Isoaimo commends the leadership of the Prime Minister Jame Marape and the Pangu led Government for prioritising sustainable energy development and for endorsing these five sub- sector policies through the NEC. He said National Executive Council approval has elevated the five policies as official government policy.

This milestone reflects the strong commitment of the government to make clean, reliable, and affordable energy a national priority. I also wish to recognise Mr Ronald Meketa, managing director of the NEA, together with his dedicated staff.

"The commitment, extra effort, and perseverance you have shown in producing five comprehensive sub-sector policies within such a short period of time is nothing short of remarkable," Mr Isoaimo said.

" I salute you for your tireless work and dedication to the nation's development. Today, we gather not only to launch policies, but to chart a new course for the future of energy sector in our nation."

Mr Meketa also highlighted the importance of energy as it was the main driver for economic growth and aspiration of any country.

And for too long over the past years previous governments have not invested enough in the energy sector or renewal energy to drive the country forward, that resulted in 80 per cent of the country still need proper energy source and have no access to proper electricity.

PNG has a lot of potential in the renewal energy sector unlike other. countries in the world, but the challenges is how to go about to harness those energy with the government and investors support
excerpt:
"Today we gather not only to launch policies but to charter a new course for energy sector."

PETER ISOAIMO (MINISTER FOR ENERGY)
author: Hezron Kising

title: Eywa Systems Supports EU-FCCB Digital Transformation in Papua New Guinea
content:
Eywa Systems has announced its active support for the European Union–Forestry, Climate Change and Biodiversity Programme (EU-FCCB) in Papua New Guinea (PNG), delivering cutting-edge digital solutions to accelerate the country’s environmental governance and sustainable development agenda.


The EU-FCCB programme, implemented by Expertise France in partnership with PNG’s government institutions, focuses on strengthening climate action, forest conservation, and biodiversity management. Eywa Systems has been engaged to design and implement advanced digital platforms that enable transparent reporting, improved collaboration, and long-term sustainability of PNG’s climate and forest monitoring frameworks.



Driving Digital Transformation in Climate Governance


As part of the engagement, Eywa Systems is leading the development and integration of several mission-critical solutions, including:


  • The National Carbon Registry (NCR): A secure, modern platform to register and track carbon projects, aligned with UNFCCC Article 6 requirements and global carbon market standards.
  • Safeguards Information Systems (SIS): A comprehensive tool to monitor and report on social and environmental safeguards under the REDD+ framework.
  • Agency Websites and Digital Infrastructure: Modernisation of websites and ICT systems across key FCCB partner agencies, including the Climate Change and Development Authority (CCDA), the Papua New Guinea Forest Authority (PNGFA), the Department of Lands and Physical Planning (DLPP), and the Conservation and Environment Protection Authority (CEPA).


Through these initiatives, Eywa Systems is enabling PNG to improve the integrity of its data, ensure compliance with international climate finance mechanisms, and strengthen transparency in managing natural resources.



Building Capacity and Resilience


In addition to system development, Eywa Systems is providing capacity building and knowledge transfer to ensure sustainability. Training workshops on ICT governance, cybersecurity, and data management are equipping local teams with the skills needed to operate and maintain the new platforms.


“Digital transformation is a cornerstone of effective climate action,” said Benjamin Irani, Principal Solutions Engineer at Eywa Systems. “By combining cutting-edge technology with local ownership, we are helping PNG build robust systems that not only meet today’s reporting requirements but also support long-term resilience and sustainable development.”



A Strategic Partnership


Eywa Systems’ support to the EU-FCCB programme underscores its long-standing expertise in delivering digital transformation for climate action, combining advanced ICT solutions with international development priorities.


The partnership reflects Eywa’s commitment to supporting countries like Papua New Guinea in bridging technology with sustainability—empowering governments to meet international obligations while ensuring benefits for local communities and ecosystems.


About Eywa Systems

Eywa Systems is a Denmark-based digital transformation company specialising in software engineering, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and AI solutions. With a track record of supporting international organisations, government agencies, and NGOs, Eywa Systems empowers institutions to modernise operations, strengthen governance, and achieve sustainable growth.
